isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON 16709 AND 16710 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 134). If previously removed, install the roll pin in the keyway.

Install the 4th speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 1st or bottom groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 135). Feed a plastic air line up from the bottom of the mainshaft to secure the washer.
Place the 4th speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 136).

note.para: Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with the clutching teeth in the gear hubs. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each gear in the mainshaft assembly.

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear and spacer on the shaft against 4th speed (or Overdrive) gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 137).
Install the 3rd speed washer. Rotate the washer to align the splines and feed the plastic air line up to hold the washer in place ( Figure 138).

Insert two suitable pry bars between the 3rd and 4th speed (or Overdrive) gears to check axial clearances ( Figure 139). Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance is less than the minimum .005" to .012" . If the clearance is less than the minimum .005" tolerance, the limit washer in the 3rd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the 3rd speed gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.
Install the 2nd-3rd speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the plastic air line feed line up ( Figure 140).

Install the 2nd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 3rd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and feed the plastic air line up through the washer ( Figure 141). Also install the spacer at this time.

para.emph: Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft Gears

step1.para: Axial Clearance (End Play) Limits Are: .005" - .012" for all mainshaft gears
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; six thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style tolerance washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .258-.260.)

step1.para: Always use the .248-.250 low limit washer (White or White plus red) in the 2nd and 4th speed gear positions as shown in Figure 142.

important.para: Refer to the appropriate illustrated parts list (specified by model series) to ensure that proper parts are used during reassembly of the transmission.

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 143).
Install the 1st speed gear on the shaft against the 2nd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 144).

Install the spacer in 1st speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 145). Place the limit washer into 1st gear and rotate the washer to align the splines, then feed plastic air line up the mainshaft.
Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the 1st and 2nd speed gears as described in step 6 ( Figure 146).
Install the 1st-reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the plastic air line and feed the line up ( Figure 147).

Install the reverse gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate washer in the 5th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and feed the plastic air line up ( Figure 148). Install the spacer.
Install the snap ring in the 6th groove of the mainshaft to retain the key in the keyway ( Figure 149).
Install the snap ring in the hub of the reverse gear ONLY TO CHECK AXIAL CLEARANCE (END PLAY) LIMITS ( Figure 150).
Install the reverse gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 151).
Install the auxiliary drive gear assembly in its proper position on the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 152).

Separate the auxiliary drive gear and reverse gear by placing two screwdrivers 180 degrees opposite each other between the gears ( Figure 153). Allow the weight of the screwdrivers to separate the gears; do not apply downward pressure to screwdrivers. Check the clearance between the auxiliary drive gear and reverse gear. Select a limit washer that will provide a clearance of .005 to .012 inch between the gears.

With the proper reverse gear limit washer installed on the mainshaft, remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly and reverse gear ( Figure 154). Remove the snap ring from the hub of the reverse gear and reinstall the gear on the mainshaft. Engage the clutching teeth of the gear with the splines of the spacer and sliding clutch and move the reverse gear against the 1st speed gear.

Remove the snap ring from the 6th groove of the mainshaft ( right, Figure 155). Place the mainshaft key in line with the plastic air line. While pulling the line out, follow it down with the mainshaft key (left). Reinstall the snap ring after the key is seated.
